Header: Union members, ‘yellow vests’ march against French government in Nantes
Content: Thousands of protesters hailing from French unions marched with “yellow vest” protesters in the western French city of Nantes to protest French President Emmanuel Macron’s government. Carrying banners and flags and chanting anti-government slogans, the demonstrators marched to denounce difficult conditions in the country’s employment sector and income inequality. Both unionists and “yellow vests” agreed that joining forces would help each others’ causes. Tuesday’s demonstration marked the first time unions and “yellow vests” joined forces since the start of the turbulent movement.
